process.heading: How an engagement works
process.subtitle: No 47-slide proposals. No three-month discovery phases. Here's what actually happens.

steps.title: Strategy call
steps.body: We talk for 30 minutes. You tell us what's broken, what you've tried, and what good looks like. We tell you honestly whether we're the right fit. If we are, we send a scope and timeline within 48 hours.

steps.title: Design and build
steps.body: We handle positioning, copy, design, and Webflow development in parallel, not in sequence. You see working pages, not static mockups. Your team reviews in weekly syncs and has CMS access from week two.

steps.title: Launch and measure
steps.body: We launch, set up analytics, and establish baseline metrics. No vanity dashboards. We track the numbers that connect to pipeline: organic traffic, conversion rates, form submissions, and qualified lead volume.

steps.title: Grow and optimize
steps.body: SEO, AEO, and CRO kick in. We publish content, optimize pages, and run conversion experiments. You get a monthly report with what we did, what moved, and what we're doing next.

faq.question: What types of companies do you work with?
faq.answer: B2B SaaS companies, primarily Series A and later. Our clients typically have a product in market, a marketing team (even if it's one person), and a website that isn't pulling its weight. We've worked across verticals — fintech, healthtech, devtools, HR tech, cybersecurity — but the common thread is always B2B SaaS.

faq.question: Why Webflow instead of a custom-coded site?
faq.answer: Speed and independence. Webflow lets us ship a production-quality site in weeks instead of months, and your marketing team can update pages, publish content, and launch campaigns without filing engineering tickets. For most B2B SaaS companies under $100M ARR, a custom-coded marketing site is overkill, and the maintenance cost quietly drains budget every quarter.

faq.question: Do we have to sign up for growth services, or can we just get a website?
faq.answer: You can start with a website build only. Most of our clients do. About 70% of them add SEO and CRO within the first three months after launch, because by then they've seen the site perform and want to push it further. But there's no obligation and no bait-and-switch.

faq.question: How long does a website project take?
faq.answer: Most builds go from kickoff to launch in 4-6 weeks. That includes strategy, copywriting, design, and Webflow development. Larger projects with complex CMS structures or multiple product lines can take 8-10 weeks. We'll give you a specific timeline in the scoping call before you commit to anything.

faq.question: What does the growth engagement look like month to month?
faq.answer: We run SEO (technical and content), AEO (AI search optimization), and CRO (conversion experiments) on a monthly retainer. You get a dedicated team, weekly async updates, and a monthly performance review. We track organic traffic, keyword rankings, conversion rates, and qualified leads. Minimum engagement is three months — SEO needs at least that long to show meaningful results.

faq.question: We already have a website. Can you optimize it without rebuilding?
faq.answer: Sometimes. If your current site is on Webflow or a platform we can work with efficiently, we can run SEO and CRO on what you have. If the site itself is the bottleneck — slow, hard to update, poorly structured for search — we'll tell you that honestly. We won't spend six months optimizing a site that needs to be rebuilt.
